oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Engagement announcement of Kathryn Parrish, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1933
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scrapbook page related to the engagement announcement of Miss Kathryn Parrish, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William McMurray Parrish, to James Collins Thurman (Mr. and Mrs. James Collins Thurman, Jr.). The Parrish-Thurman announcement was published in the newspaper, stating “Mr. and Mrs. W. M. Parrish, of Nashville, announce the engagement of their daughter, Kathryn, to James Collins Thurman, Jr. The wedding will take place June 6 [1933] in Nashville. Miss Parrish is the sister of Miss Polly Parrish, student at Vanderbilt University. She is a graduate of Ward-Belmont college and is a member of the Nashville Junior League and of the Nashville Girls’ Cotillion club. She has studied dancing with Paul Mathis, of Nashville, and is a dancing instructor. Mr. Thurman is a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. C. Thurman and is the brother of Miss Josephine Thurman and William Clifford Thurman. He is a graduate of McCallie school, attended Vanderbilt University and is a member of Phi Delta Theta fraternity. He is connected with the Pure Ice Company.” Forms part of the James C. Thurman Collection. 1 scrapbook page ; b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parrish, Kathryn; Thurman family; Thurman, James C.
